abstract: More that 14,700 taxpayers have disclosed secret foreign bank accounts, the Internal Revenue Services said Tuesday, under an amnesty program that let them avoid prosecution for tax evasion.
snippet: More that 14,700 taxpayers have disclosed secret foreign bank accounts, the Internal Revenue Services said Tuesday, under an amnesty program that let them avoid prosecution for tax evasion.
lead_paragraph: Update | 3:51 p.m. More that 14,700 taxpayers have disclosed secret foreign bank accounts, the Internal Revenue Service said on Tuesday, under an amnesty program that let them avoid prosecution for tax evasion.
